fields.description:
Hi All,

We were running 3.2.1 version of Eucalyptus on the following multi-cluster setup with only ESXi as hypervisor:

{code}
192.168.58.11 - CLC
192.168.58.13 - Walrus
192.168.58.14 - VMWare Broker/CC - Cluster name - acme-a
192.168.58.16 - VMware Broker/CC - Cluster name - acme-b
192.168.58.15 - SC - Storage Controller for acme-a
192.168.58.17 - SC - Storage Controller for acme-b
{code}

Then we upgraded this cloud on to 3.3.0 and since then WALRUS, both SCs became NOTREADY. We have tried rebooting the servers as well as restarting the eucalyptus-cloud services on individual hosts to no luck. Nothing worked. 

In the end, We tried to run euca-modify-service against one of the SC (192.168.58.15) like this hoping we could get it to ENABLED state:

{code}
euca-modify-service -s STOPPED "SC:acme-a"
euca-modify-service -s ENABLED "SC:acme-a"
{code}

The last command gave following error:

{code}
Error(400 Bad Request): java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: java.lang.RuntimeException: com.eucalyptus.ws.EucalyptusRemoteFault: Action:ProblemAction Code:soapenv:Client Id:RelatesTo Error: java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: com.google.common.util.concurrent.UncheckedExecutionException: com.google.common.collect.ComputationException: com.eucalyptus.util.EucalyptusCloudException: Unable to run command: Task java.util.concurrent.FutureTask@17754cf rejected from java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor@2c3691a8[Terminated, pool size = 0, active threads = 0, queued tasks = 0, completed tasks = 7]java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: com.google.common.util.concurrent.UncheckedExecutionException: com.google.common.collect.ComputationException: com.eucalyptus.util.EucalyptusCloudException: Unable to run command: Task java.util.concurrent.FutureTask@17754cf rejected from java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor@2c3691a8[Terminated, pool size = 0, active threads = 0, queued tasks = 0, completed tasks = 7]
{code}

Above error is also visible on the logs of the CLC.

The SC went to BROKEN state and is currently BROKEN. Both Walrus and EBS functionality is unavailable on production cloud henceforth. 

Following is the output of euca-describe-services -E on the cloud:

{code}
SERVICE euare           eucalyptus      192.168.58.11    ENABLED         64      http://192.168.58.11:8773/services/Euare     arn:euca:eucalyptus::euare:192.168.58.11/
SERVICEEVENT    547fa3f9-c600-4af4-ab0e-4f7e9d42a6d6    arn:euca:eucalyptus:::192.168.58.11/
SERVICEEVENT    547fa3f9-c600-4af4-ab0e-4f7e9d42a6d6    ERROR
SERVICEEVENT    547fa3f9-c600-4af4-ab0e-4f7e9d42a6d6    Wed Aug 07 11:40:43 IST 2013
SERVICEEVENT    547fa3f9-c600-4af4-ab0e-4f7e9d42a6d6    LoadBalancingPropertyBootstrapper.enable( ): returned false, terminating bootstrap for component: loadbalancing

SERVICE walrus          walrus          walrus          NOTREADY        64      http://192.168.58.13:8773/services/Walrus    arn:euca:bootstrap:walrus:walrus:walrus/
SERVICEEVENT    2feb36e4-04f8-4a93-aa74-e6c9a42c2062    arn:euca:bootstrap:walrus:walrus:walrus/
SERVICEEVENT    2feb36e4-04f8-4a93-aa74-e6c9a42c2062    ERROR

fields.summary: Remote SC and Walrus goes NOTREADY after upgrade to 3.3.0
fields.environment:
* Linux Distribution: CentOS 6.4 x86_64
* Network Mode: MANAGED-NOVLAN 
* Non-HA
* Multi-cluster with only VMWare hypervisor
* Remote SC and Remote Walrus

comments.body:
Steps Regarding the Upgrade Process:

* I installed the new Eucalyptus release package in all the components.

** {code} 
yum install http://downloads.eucalyptus.com/software/eucalyptus/3.3/centos/6/x86_64/eucalyptus-release-3.3.noarch.rpm
{code}
 
* I installed the new euca2ools release package in all the components.
 
** {code}
yum --nogpgcheck install http://downloads.eucalyptus.com/software/euca2ools/3.0/centos/6/x86_64/euca2ools-release-3.0.noarch.rpm
{code}
 
* I had stopped all the instances running on the cloud before installing the above packages.

* I stopped all the components in the sequence as in the document ( http://www.eucalyptus.com/docs/eucalyptus/3.3/install-guide/upgrade_shutdown.html#upgrade_shutdown )

* Then I did yum update which was updated only for the two SC's and for other components it gave the output which I posted on the community Q&A ( https://engage.eucalyptus.com/customer/portal/questions/1404558-unable-to-upgrading-3-3 )

* I cleaned the cache with command "yum clean expire-cache".

* Again the "yum update 'eucalyptus*'" which again got updated only for both SC's and for other components it gave the output which I posted on the community Q&A ( https://engage.eucalyptus.com/customer/portal/questions/1404558-unable-to-upgrading-3-3 ) 

* Then I tried to upgrade the euca2ools which again got updated only for both SC's.

* I started the cloud only the SC's gave me the upgraded message from 3.2.2 to 3.3 and all components were enabled.

* It was then I posted the question on Eucalyptus community which you helped me edit the version from 3.2 to 3.3 in /etc/yum.repos.d ( https://engage.eucalyptus.com/customer/portal/questions/1404558-unable-to-upgrading-3-3 ) 

* I made the changes in /etc/yum.repos.d.and stopped all components and installed all packages. 

* It all went smoothly and when i started the cloud, it gave  me the upgrade message for all components except for SC's as they were already  upgraded.

* All the components were enabled except the SC's and Walrus.

* Also followed the information contained in DOC-959

Package listing is as follows:

* CLC
{code}
eucalyptus-cloud-3.3.0-0.0.1140.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-admin-tools-3.3.0-0.0.1140.el6.noarch

{code}

* Walrus

* CC (acme-a)

* SC (acme-a)

{code}

* SC {acme-b}
{code}
eucalyptus-common-java-3.3.0-0.0.1140.el6.x86_64

python-eucadmin-3.3.0-0.0.1140.el6.noarch
euca2ools-release-3.0-1.el6.noarch

eucalyptus-3.3.0-0.0.1140.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-enterprise-vmware-broker-libs-3.3.0-0.0.1052.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-sc-3.3.0-0.0.1140.el6.x86_64
{code}

I am seeing that the customer has eucalyptus-release-3.3-1.el6.noarch.rpm installed? Should these actually be eucalyptus-release-3.3.noarch.rpm?  
see http://downloads.eucalyptus.com/software/eucalyptus/3.3/centos/6/x86_64/

In the customers euca-describe-components output it seems that the walrus and storage components are stuck in the PRIMORDIAL state and there is no associated ip addresses. The walrus and storage controllers do not appear to be registered? Maybe the registration was corrupted during the incomplete upgrade that was performed before the /etc/yum.repos.d was updated to 3.3.  I am also not seeing any registered vmwarebrokers? 

Try registering the walrus, storage controllers and vmwarebrokers again.
Kindly confirm if no data loss would occur if we register the SC , Walrus and broker components again.
Registering the components should not cause data loss, however data loss may have already occurred when the system was partially upgraded and the registration was lost.

You may want to take a look at http://www.eucalyptus.com/docs/eucalyptus/3.3/install-guide/upgrade_failure.html#upgrade_failure

1) revert to 3.2.2
2) start fresh upgrade process

Customer asks following

So should I first register Walrus, Vmwarebroker, SC and then revert to 3.2.2?

1) Try registering the missing components first and see if all the components start correctly. If this works then stop you are done.
2) If (1)  does not work then revert it to 3.2.2 and make sure everything starts correctly, then start the upgrade process again.

I am with customer on remote screen sharing session performing the step (2) as (1) has failed and resulted in the same situation we were in the beginning.

I will keep you posted. Thanks for your help.

OK. We resolved this issue by successfully downgrading the cloud to 3.2.2 and then verifying all services are ENABLED and working in 3.2.2 then again performing the upgrade to 3.3.0

Now the cloud is successfully running 3.3.0 with all services ENABLED. 

Just to make a note here that during downgrade when we tried to start the eucalyptus-cloud services on the CLC and other hosts we found the error 

{code}
2013-08-14 11:36:49  INFO | Trying to determine local bind address based on cli (--bind-addr)...
2013-08-14 11:36:49  INFO | Trying to determine local bind address based on the default route...
2013-08-14 11:36:50  INFO | ==> Decided to use local bind address: /172.30.58.11
2013-08-14 11:37:00  INFO | ================================================================================
                          | Populating binding cache.
                          | ================================================================================
2013-08-14 11:37:00 FATAL | java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: edu/ucsb/eucalyptus/msgs/BaseMessage : Unsupported major.minor version 51.0
java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: edu/ucsb/eucalyptus/msgs/BaseMessage : Unsupported major.minor version 51.0
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(ClassLoader.java:634)
        at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(SecureClassLoader.java:142)
        at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(URLClassLoader.java:277)

        at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
        at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:205)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:321)
        at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:294)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:266)
        at java.lang.Class.forName0(Native Method)
        at java.lang.Class.forName(Class.java:188)
        at com.eucalyptus.binding.BindingCache$BindingFileSearch.<init>(BindingCache.java:163)
        at com.eucalyptus.binding.BindingCache$BindingFileSearch.<clinit>(BindingCache.java:144)
        at com.eucalyptus.binding.BindingCache.compileBindings(BindingCache.java:139)

{code}

We ended up clearing the /var/run/eucalyptus/* on all machines running Eucalyptus before starting the services. Also we had to downgrade euca2ools to 2.1.3 which was not mentioned in the downgrade document.

Hey [~dshekhawat],

Great work here.  I checked out [Eucalyptus 3.3 Installation Guide, regarding dealing with failed upgrades|http://www.eucalyptus.com/docs/eucalyptus/3.3/install-guide/upgrade_failure.html#upgrade_failure], and we don't mention the information above.  I will raise a DOC ticket to make sure we get this documented accordingly.  Thanks again for this.  Please add any feedback you have regarding improving the Installation Guide to the DOC ticket.
Added DOC-977 to add in additional information to the failed upgrades section of the Eucalyptus 3.3 Installation Guide.
